All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AudioPlayer
The AudioPlayer class provides functionality to play audio files.
Chunk
Chunk holds an nxn array of PositionBlocks and stores the x and y position of the entire array.
ChunkManager
ChunkManager loads and holds the chunks that will be used in the game.
CollisionDetection
Stores the two collision functions we use for our game, MazeRunner.
EmptyBlock
EmptyBlock represents a empty space in the maze.
EndBlock
EmptyBlock represents the end location of the Maze.
Enemy
This file holds Enemy.java, Mage, Ghost, EnemyFactory, MageFactory, and GhostFactory.
Enemy.DrawingPanel
Drawing panel used solely for testing purposes
EnemyFactory
EnemyFactory will be used to create up to five enemy factory classes: Beaver, Ghost, Mage, Necromancer, and Salamander.
finalWinScreen
GameOverLOSE creates the game over screen when the user fails to find the end of the maze.
GameOverLOSE
GameOverLOSE creates the game over screen when the user fails to find the end of the maze.
GameOverWIN
GameOverWIN creates the panel shown when user finds the end of the maze.
GamePanel
GamePanel handles creating the screen and contains the main game loop.
GameVariables
Stores constant variables that multiple classes need.
GameVariables.Facing
The direction the sprite is currently facing.
GameVariables.State
Sprite States.
Ghost
Ghost is a child of Enemy with attributes and unique images.
GhostFactory
GhostFactory will load the static images for Ghosts and create enemies using the createEnemy function.
HomeScreen
HomeScreen creates the home screen.
KeyHandler
Handles key events.
Leaderboard
Loads and updates the leaderboard that tracks the fastest times to complete the game.
Mage
Mage is a child of Enemy with attributes and unique images.
MageFactory
MageFactory will load the Mage images and create Mage instances using the createEnemy function.
Main
Serves as the main file for our game.
Player
Player holds character attributes including images, state (Idle, Move...), facing (N, NE, E...) and methods including loading images, updating state, and drawing.
PositionBlock
PositionBlock creates a individual block of the maze, which could be a wall, empty space, start block, or end block.
Screen
Abstract class used for the screens of our game.
StartingBlock
StartingBlock represents the start location of the Maze.
Visibility
This class handles drawing the visibility of the player in our game.
Wall
Wall class represents a wall in the maze.
